title: I'm new to poetry how do I write stanzas and proper formatting? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hey so I took a look at ILLUMIN8TE – Elecricity of the mind  and I say -- don't worry about that! What you're doing now is like freestyle, and it's all about flow.  On the page, line breaks in free verse (not formal rhymed and metered) work to emphasize specific words or to drag you over from one line to the next, sometimes to  a hard or unexpected landing. There's a nice discussion here: QUESTION FOR YA!: structure in free verse- line breaks and punctuation (showing 1-14 of 14)  and some thoughts about the subject here: Poetry: Forms: Free Verse (3)  You can mess up a good poem with bad line breaks, because it puts in weird pauses that make you think about Christopher Walken or just word salad what are you trying to say confusion. You know? So play with it. Let it be your own thing. The way you would play with the length of sentences or phrases. Oh, you should probably do a spell check, though.

This varies widely. I highly recommend you get a copy of the Princton Encyclopedia of Poetry and Poetics. This is my go to book. I never regretted buying it. It's the trustworthy standard. You might feel overwhelmed by it as a new poet but later as you grow will be glad you have it on hand. I also suggest you mosie on over to The World's Largest Poetry Site They LOVE new poets over there! And while you are at it, buy my book. It will warm you up to poetry. I have prompts in that book specifically geared at new poets. Amazon.com: golden words diane shatto
